p: The HMPV surface glycoproteins G and F have both been tested as vaccine antigens. When F and G genes were individually expressed in recombinant human parainfluenza virus-type 1 (hPIV-1) constructs and tested in hamsters, the F construct exhibited better immunogenicity [ 63]. In a separate study, when a soluble G protein was expressed (ectodomain without transmembrane domain or cytoplasmic tail), it did not elicit neutralizing antibodies or protection from challenge in cotton rats [ 64]. In contrast, HMPV F vaccines have been produced using a variety of different vector systems and have repeatedly generated protective immune responses in preclinical animal models [ 59, 60, 61].
